Chronological Bibliography on Color Theory

 

ISBN 978-987-24707-4-6

Last updated: April 2024

compiled by Jos Luis Caivano

with the assistance of Paulina Becerra

Collaborators: Juliana Agostinelli, Rodrigo Amuchstegui, Gracia Cutuli, Mario Echegaray, Julieta Garavaglia, Mabel Lpez, Cristina Manganiello, Mara Luisa Musso, Manuel Net, Andrea Pappier, Pablo Valle

Color Research Program, School of Architecture, Design and Urbanism, University of Buenos Aires

Grupo Argentino del Color

Buenos Aires, Argentina

 

 

Caivano, Jos Luis

Chronological Bibliography on Color Theory. - 1a ed.
Buenos Aires : Grupo Argentino del Color, 2014.

E-Book

ISBN 978-987-24707-4-6

 

1. Teora del Color. I. Ttulo

CDD 535.6

 

 

This database includes books, doctoral dissertations and old manuscripts dealing with color theory. Books are dated according to the publication of the first edition or, in the case of old manuscripts, the date of writing. Also, information about translations and posterior editions is provided. When available, links to PDF files of the books are provided.

 

If you see that some book is lacking, send the information to caivano@fadu.uba.ar

 

If you have published a book, and it does not appear here, please, send a copy to: Programa Color, Secretara de Investigaciones, Facultad de Arquitectura UBA, Ciudad Universitaria Pab. 3 piso 4, C1428BFA Buenos Aires, Argentina

 

Style of the entries

 

AUTHOR [birth-death]. Year of publication of 1st edition or year of writing. Title. Language (City of publication or writing, Country: Publisher).
Posterior editions.
Translations and posterior editions in each language.
{subject}

 

 

Chronological Bibliography

 

circa 360 Before Christ

PLATO [428-347 BC]. -360 (circa). Timaios. Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
Greek edition, Timaios, in Platonis opera omnia, vol. VII, edited by Gottfried Stallbaum (Gotha-Erfurt, 1838).
Greek edition, Timaios, in Platonis opera, vol IV, edited by John Burnet (Oxford, England: E. Typographeo Clarendoniano, 1905).
English translation by Benjamin Jowett, Timaeus, in The Dialogues of Plato, vol. II (Oxford, 1871), reprinted in Sources of colour science, edited by David Lewis MacAdam (Cambridge, Massachusetts: The MIT Press, 1970).
Electronic version of Benjamin Jowetts English translation (1998). In: www.gutenberg.org.
English translation in Greek-English bilingual edition by R. D. Archer-Hind, The Timaeus of Plato (London: MacMillan, 1888).
English translation by Francis Macdonald Cornford, Platos Cosmology. The Timaeus (London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1937).
French translation by Thomas-Henri Martin in Greek-French bilingual edition, tudes sur le Time de Platon (Paris, 1841).
French translation by Albert Rivaud in Greek-French bilingual edition, Time-Critias, in Oeuvres completes, vol. X (Paris: Les Belles Lettres, 1949).
French translation by Luc Brisson and Michel Patillon, Platon. Time / Critias (Paris: Flammarion, 1992).
German translation by Otto Apelt, Platons Dialoge Timaios und Kritias (Leipzig, 1922).
German translation by R. Kapferer and A. Fingerle, Platons Timaios oder Die Schrift ber die Natur (Stuttgart, 1952).
German translation by F. Schleiermacher and H. Mller in Greek-German bilingual edition, Timaios, Kritias, Philebos (Darmstadt: Wiss. Buchg., 1972).
Italian translation by G. Giarratano, Timeo (Roma and Bari: Laterza, 1950). New edition 1982.
Italian translation by Giovanni Reale, Timeo (Milan: Rusconi, 1991).
Latin translation in Greek-Latin bilingual edition, Timaios, in Platonis opera, vol. I, edited by R. B. Hirschig (Paris: Ambrosio Firmin-Didot, 1873-1880).
Spanish translation by Patricio de Azcrate, Timeo o de la naturaleza, in Platn, Apologa de Scrates, Dilogos (Buenos Aires: El Ateneo, 1949), 645-758.
Spanish translation by Francisco de P. Samaranch, Timeo (Buenos Aires: Aguilar, 1963). 2nd edition 1966.
Spanish translation by Francisco Lisi, Platn. Dilogos VI. Filebo, Timeo, Critias (Madrid: Gredos, Biblioteca Clsica, 1992).
Spanish translation by Conrado Eggers Lan, Timeo (Buenos Aires: Colihue, 1999).
Spanish edition in electronic format, Timeo o de la naturaleza (Santiago de Chile: Universidad de Arte y Ciencias Sociales, ARCIS, Escuela de Filosofa, 2002). In: www.philosophia.cl.
{natural philosophy}

 

circa 350 Before Christ

ARISTOTLE [384-322 BC]. -350 (circa). Meteorologica (book III). Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
Included in Aristoteles opera, edited by Bekker (Berlin, 1831-1870).
Critical edition by F. H. Fobes (Cambridge, Massachussets: Harvard University Press, 1919).
English translation by W. S. Hett in Greek-English bilingual edition (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1936).
Electronic version of the English translation by E. W. Webster, Meteorology (2000). In: http://classics.mit.edu.
French translation by J. Tricot, Les mtorologiques (Paris: Vrin, 1941).
Latin translation by J. L. Ideler, in Greek-Latin bilingual edition, Aristotelis Meteorologicorum (Leipzig, 1834-1836).
Latin translation in Greek-Latin bilingual edition, Meteorologica, in Aristotelis opera omnia (Paris: Ambrosio Firmin-Didot, 1874-1878).
{natural philosophy, astronomy}

ARISTOTLE [384-322 BC]. -350 (circa). Peri Aistheseos Kai Aistheton. Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
English translation by G. R. T. Ross (Cambridge, 1906).
English translation by W. S. Hett in Greek-English bilingual edition, On sense and sensible objects, in Aristotle: On the soul, Parva naturalia, On breath (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1936).
Electronic version of the English translation by J. I. Beare, On sense and the sensible (2000). In: http://classics.mit.edu.
Latin translation, De sensu et sensibilia.
{sensation, perception}

ARISTOTLE [384-322 BC]. -350 (circa). Peri Psukhes (book II). Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
Greek edition with introduction and commentary in English by W. D. Ross, De anima (London, 1961).
English translation by W. S. Hett in Greek-English bilingual edition, On the soul, in Aristotle: On the soul, Parva naturalia, On breath (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1936).
English translation by J. A. Smith, On the soul (Oxford, England: Clarendon Press, 1931).
Electronic version of J. A. Smiths English translation (2000). In: http://classics.mit.edu.
French translation by J. Tricot, De lame (Paris, 1959).
French translation by E. Barbotin in Greek-French bilingual edition, De lame (Paris: Les Belles Lettres, 1966).
Italian translation by P. Eusebietti, Dellanima (Turin, Italy, 1931).
Latin translation, De anima.
Spanish translation by Alfredo Llanos, De anima (Buenos Aires: Leviatn, 1983).
Spanish translation by Toms Calvo Martnez, Acerca del alma (Madrid: Biblioteca Bsica Gredos, 2004).
{natural philosophy, metaphysics}

 

circa 322-269 Before Christ

ARISTOTELIC SCHOOL [c.322-269 BC]. -322-269 (circa). Peri Khromaton. Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
English translation by W. S. Hett in Greek-English bilingual edition, On colours, in Aristotle: Minor works (Cambridge, Massachusetts: Harvard University Press, 1936).
New English edition by Jonathan Barnes, On colours, in The complete works of Aristotle, vol.1 (Princeton, New Jersey, USA: Princeton University Press, 1984).
Latin translation, De coloribus libellus Aristotelis a Simone Portio interprete latinitate donatus et commentariis illustratus (Florence, Italy: Laurentii Torrentini, 1548).
New Latin edition, Aristotelis, vel Theophrasti de Coloribus libellus, a Simone Portio Neapolitano latinitate donatus, et commentariis ilustratus (Paris: Vascosanum, 1549).
Latin translation, Aristotelis stagiritae de coloribus a Coelio Calcagnino interprete, in De urinis, comp. Joannes Actuarius (Paris, 1548).
{natural philosophy}

 

322 Before Christ

THEOPHRASTUS [c.372-c.287 BC]. -322. Histora phuton. Greek (Athens, Greece: manuscript).
Latin translation by Theodoro Gaza, De historia plantarum (1483). New edition (Lyon, 1552).
{botanic}

 

circa 300 Before Christ

EUCLID [c.300 BC]. -300 (circa). Optica. Greek (Alexandria, Egypt: manuscript).
Edition by J. L. Heiberg, in Euclidis opera omnia, vol. 7 (Leipzig, Germany: Teubner, 1895).
{optics}

 

circa 200 After Christ

HERON OF ALEXANDRIA [c.200 AC]. 200 (circa). Dioptra. Greek (Alexandria, Egypt: manuscript).
Edition by H. Schne, in Heronis Alexandrini opera, vol. 3 (Leipzig, Germany: Teubner, 1903).

 

circa 400 After Christ

ANONYMOUS. 400 (circa). Papyrus leydensis (Thebes: manuscript).
Included in R. Halleux, Les alchimistes grecs. Vol. 1, Papyrus de Leyde, Papyrus de Stockholm, Fragments de Recettes (Paris: Les Belles Lettres, 1981).

 

circa 780 After Christ

ANONYMOUS. 780 (circa). Compositiones ad tingenda musiva, pelles et alia, ad deaurandum ferrum, ad mineralia, crysographiam, ad glutina quaedam conficienda, aliaque artium documenta. Latin (Luca, Italy: manuscript).
Published in Antiquitates Italicae Medii Aevi, vol. 2, by Ludovico Antonio Muratori (Milan, 1738-1743).

 

1000

HERACLIUS, Fl. 1000 (circa). De coloribus et artibus romanorum, book 2 [according to Codice 145, Public Library of Valenciennes]. Latin (manuscript).
Edited and published by A. Giry (Paris, 1873).
New Latin edition in Original treatises, edited by Mary P. Merrifield (1849).
German translation by Albert Ilg, Von den Farben und Knsten der Rmer, Latin-German bilingual edition (Vienna, 1873).

 

1025

ALHAZEN (Abu-Ali Al-Hasan ibn al-Haytham) [c.965-1039]. 1025 (circa). [Treasury of optics]. {optics}

 

1120

THEOPHILUS (Roger of Helmarshausen) [c.1070-1125]. 1120 (circa). Schedula diversarum artium, or De diversis artibus. Latin (Germany: manuscript).
Edition by Albert Ilg, Theophilus presbyter Schedula diversarum artium (Vienna, 1874).
English translation by R. Hendrie (London, 1847).
English translation, Of many arts, 1961.
English translation by C. R. Dodwell, The various arts (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1986).
French translation, Essay sur divers arts, including the chapter (pp. 11-73) La peinture, les couleurs et les matriaux (1843).
{arts, painting}

 

1230

GROSSETESTE, Robert [c.1175-1253]. 1230 (circa). De colore. Latin (England: manuscript).
First published in Beitrge zur Geschichte der Philosophie des Mittelalters, vol. IX (Mnster, Germany: Freie Kunstschule, 1912).
English translation included in Dinkova-Bruun et al. 2013.
{natural philosophy}

GROSSETESTE, Robert [c.1175-1253]. 1230 (circa). De iride seu de iride et speculo. Latin (England: manuscript).
First published in Beitrge zur Geschichte der Philosophie des Mittelalters, vol. IX (Mnster, Germany: Freie Kunstschule, 1912).
{natural philosophy, optics}

 

1245

ANGLICUS, Bartholomaeus [c.1200]. 1245 (circa). De proprietatibus rerum [including De coloribus, chapter 19].
Latin (Magdeburg, Germany: manuscript).
English translation by Trevisa, and 1st printing, 1495.
{natural philosophy, optics}

 

1304

THEODORIC OF FREIBURG. 1304 (circa). De iride. Latin. {optics}

 

1350

ANONYMOUS. 1350 (circa). De arte illuminandi. Latin (Venice, Italy: manuscript).
Edited by Franco Brunello (Venice, 1975).
{painting, graphic arts}

SAINT-OMER, Pietro of (Brother Mauro). 1350 (circa). Liber magistri Petri de Sancto Audemaro de coloribus faciendis. Latin (manuscript).
New Latin edition in Original treatises, edited by Mary P. Merrifield (1849).

 

inter 1398-1411

ALCHERIUS. 1398-1411 (inter). De coloribus diversis modis tractatur... Ad tingendam rosam. Latin (manuscript).

 

circa 1423

COURTOIS, Jean (or Jean of Hainaut, or Sicille, Herald of Sicily to Alfonso V, king of Aragon) [?-1436]. 1423 (circa). Le blason des couleurs... French (Mons, Belgique: manuscript).
First printed edition (Paris, France: Pierre Le Caron, 1495).
New French edition (Lyon, France: Claude Noury, 1503).
New French edition, Le blason des couleurs en armes, livrees et divises (Lyon, France: Germain Rouze and Olivier Arnoullet, 1528).
New French edition (Philippe le Noir).
New French edition by Hippolyte Cocheris, Le blason des couleurs en armes, livres et divises (Paris: Auguste Aubry, 1860).
Italian translation by Giuseppe Dondi dallOrologio, Trattato dei colori nelle arme, nelle livree et nelle divise (Venice, Italy: 1535).
New Italian edition (Pavia, Italy: A. Viani, 1593).
New Italian edition (Venice, Italy: Appresso Lucio Spineda, 1606).
{heraldry}

 

1435

ALBERTI, Leon Battista [1404-1472]. 1435. De pictura. Latin (Florence, Italy: manuscript).
Printed version (Basel, Switzerland: Thomas Venatorium, 1540).
Printed version (Leiden, The Netherlands: Elzevir, 1649).
Latin and Italian (Volgare) edition by Cecil Grayson (Bari: Laterza, 1980). Electronic version taken from this edition (1998). In: www.liberliber.it.
English translation, Of painting, in The architecture of Leon Battista Alberti, edited by Giacomo Leoni (London, 1726). New edition 1739. New edition (London: Edward Owen, 1755).
English translation by John R. Spencer, On painting (New Haven, Connecticut: Yale University Press, 1956).
French translation (from the Bartoli Italian translation of 1568) by DuFresne (Paris, 1651). New edition (Naples: Rispoli, 1733). New editions (Bologna, 1782, 1786).
French translation by Popelin (Paris, 1868).
German translation, in German-Italian bilingual edition by Janitschek, part of Quellenschriften fr Kunstgeschichte series (Vienna, 1877). Re-edition by Papini (Lanciano, Italy, 1913).
Italian (Volgare) version by Leon Battista Alberti, Della pittura (Florence, 1436).
Italian translation by Lodovico Domenichi (Venice, 1547).
New edition by Bartoli (Monte Regale, 1565). New edition (Florence, 1568).
Italian translation by Cosimo Bartoli, in Opere morali di Leon Battista Alberti (Venice, 1568). New edition (Bologna, 1782). New editions (Milan 1803, 1804).
Italian edition by Bonucci (Florence, 1847).
Italian critical edition by Luigi Mall (Florence: G. C. Sansoni, 1950).
Spanish translation by Diego Antonio Rejon de Silva (Madrid, 1784). New edition 1827.
Spanish translation, Sobre la pintura (Valencia: Fernando Torres Ed., 1976).
{arts, painting}

 

1437

CENNINI, Cennino [c.1370-c.1440]. 1437. Il libro dellarte o trattato della pittura. Italian (Florency, Italy: manuscript).
First edition with notes by Giuseppe Tambroni (Rome, 1821).
New edition by C. Milanesi and G. Milanesi, Trattato della pittura di Cennino Cennini (Florence, Italy: Le Monnier, 1859).
New edition by Franco Brunello, Il libro dellarte (Vicenza, Italy: Neri Pozza, 1971).
English translation by Mary Philadelphia Merrifeld, A treatise on painting (London: Edward Lumley, 1844).
English translation by Christiana J. Herringham, The book of art of Cennino Cennini (London, 1899).
English translation by Daniel Varney Thompson, The craftsmans handbook (New York: Dover, 1954). New edition 1960.
Spanish translation, Tratado de la pintura [El libro del arte] (Sucesores de E. Meseguer, 1979). New edition, El libro del arte (Madrid: Akal, 1988).
{arts, painting}

 

inter 1489-1518

LEONARDO DA VINCI [1452-1519]. 1489-1518 (inter). [Notebooks]. Italian (Florence, Milan, and Rome, Italy; and Cloux, France: manuscript).
Compilation and edition of the manuscripts by Jean Paul Richter, The literary works of Leonardo da Vinci. Italian-English bilingual edition with English translation by R. C. Bell (London: Sampson Low, Marston & Co., 1883). New edition reproducing the 1883 edition, The notebooks of Leonardo da Vinci (New York: Dover, 1970).
English translation by Edward MacCurdy, The notebooks of Leonardo da Vinci (New York: Reynal & Hitchcock, 1939).

LEONARDO DA VINCI [1452-1519]. 1489-1518 (inter). Trattata della pittura. Italian (Florence, Milan, and Rome, Italy; and Cloux, France: manuscript).
First published in a selection made by Raphael Trichet Dufresne (Paris, 1651).
New edition based on the Codice Vaticano Urbinate 1720 (Rome: Unione Cooperative Editrice, 1890).
English translation by John Francis Rigaud, A treatise on painting (London: J. B. Nichols and Son, 1835).
English translation by Philip McMahon, Treatise on painting (Princeton, New Jersey: Princeton University Press, 1956).
English edition by Martin Kemp and Margaret Walker, Leonardo on painting (London: Yale University Press, 2001).
German translation by Heinrich Ludwig, Das Buch der Malerei (Vienna, Austria: Wilhelm Braumller, 1882). New edition (Osnabrck, Germany: Otto Zeller, 1970).
Spanish translation by Mario Pittaluga, Tratado de la pintura (Buenos Aires: Losada, 1943). 2nd edition 1944. New edition (Mexico City: Espasa Calpe, 1947).
Spanish translation, Tratado de la pintura (Murcia, Spain: Colegio de Aparejadores y Arquitectos de Murcia, 1980).
Spanish translation by Rafael Galvano, Tratado de la pintura (Buenos Aires: NEED, 1999).
{arts, painting}

 

1525

EQUICOLA, Mario [1470-1525]. 1525. Libro de natura de amore. Italian (Venice, Italy).

 

1528

TELESIO, Antonio [1482-1534]. 1528. De coloribus libellus. Latin (Venice, Italy: Bernardini Vitalis). New edition (Paris, 1548).
New Latin edition (no place, probably Paris: no publisher, probably Robert Estienne; no date). This edition includes other texts on color by Marsilio Ficino, A. Gellii, and Lazarus Bayfius (Lazare de Baf).
English translation by Don Pavey, On colours, accompanied by the Latin text, with introduction, annotations and indexes by Roy Martin Osborne (London: Color Academy, Micro Academy, 2002).
French translation by Christine Viglio, with a preface and comments by Michel Indergand, Petit trait des couleurs latines (Paris: Editions Estienne, 2010).
{natural philosophy, optics, terminology}

 

1535

MORATO, Fulvio Pellegrino (born Pellegrino Moretto) [c.1483-1548]. 1535. Del significato dei colori e dei mazzolli. Italian (Venice, Italy: Giovanni Antonio Nicolini da Sabbio).
New edition (Venice: Giovanni Padovano, 1551).
New edition (Modena: Antonio Gadaldini, 1556).
New edition (Venice: Agostino Bindoni, 1558).
New edition (Brescia: Damiano Turlino, 1564).
New Italian edition, Significato dei colori e de mazzolli (Venice, Italy: Lucio Spineda,1604).
English translation and with a commentary by Roy Martin Osborne, On the signification of colours (Boca Raton, Florida, USA: BrownWalker Press, 2012).

 

1537

SCALIGER, Julius Caesar [1484-1558]. 1537. Exotericarum exercitationum de subtilitate ad H. Cardanum [the thoughts on color appear in the 325th exercise, 20 pages]. Latin (Paris, France). {natural philosophy}

 

1540

ROSETTI, Giovanventura. 1540. Plichto de larte de tentori che insegna a tenger pani telle banbasi et sede si per larthe mahiore come per la comune. Italian (Venice, Italy). {dyeing}

 

1541

PARACELSUS (Theophrastus Philipus Aureolus Bombastus von Hohenheim) [1493-1541]. 1541 (before). De tinctura physicorum. Latin (Germany). {dyeing}

 

1548

PINO, Paolo. 1548. Dialogo di pittura. Italian (Venice, Italy). New edition by C. Camesasca (Milan: Rizzoli, 1954). {arts, painting}

 

inter 1521-1555

MAUROLYCUS, Franciscus [1494-1575]. 1521-1555 (inter). Photismi de lumine et umbra ad perspectivam, et radiorum incidentiam facientes [1st part]. Diaphanorum, seu trsparentium partes, seu libri tres [2nd part]. Latin (Messina, Italy: manuscript).
First published (Naples: Tarquino Longo, 1611).
French translation, De lumiere et umbre (Lyon, 1613).
Italian translation in Latin-Italian bilingual edition, Fotismi sul lume e sullombra riguardo alla prospettiva e allandamento dei raggi, and Dei corpi trasparenti, in Scritti di ottica, edited by Vasco Ronchi (Milan: Edizioni Il Polifilo, 1968), 69-131.
{optics}

 

1565

DOLCE, M. Ludovico [1508-1568]. 1565. Dialogo di M. Ludovico Dolce, nel quale si ragiona della qualit, diversit e propriet dei colori. Italian (Venice, Italy: G. B. and M. Sessa, fratelli). {arts, painting}

 

1568

CORONATO OCCOLTI, M. 1568. Trattato dei colori. Italian (Parma, Italy: Viotto).

 

1570

TELESIO, Franciscus Patritius Bernardino [1509-1588]. 1570. De colorum generatione opusculum. Latin (Naples, Italy: Iosephum Cacchiun).

 

1571

FREISCHER, J. 1571. De iridibus doctrina Aristotelis et Vitellionis. Latin (Vitembergae).

 

1576

CARDANO, Gerolamo [1501-1576]. 1576 (before). De geminis et coloribus. Latin (Italy: manuscript). First published in Opera omnia, 10 vols., vol. II, chapter X, De geminis et coloribus (Lyon, France, 1663). {natural philosophy}

 

1584

LOMAZZO, Giovanni Paolo [1538-1600]. 1584. Trattato dellarte della pittura, scultura ed architettura. Italian (Rome, Italy: Presso Savario del Monte).
English translation by John Donohue, Treatise on the arts of painting, sculpture and architecture, including the section Symbolism of the principal colors, 1844.
{painting, sculpture, architecture}

 

1589

BOLTZ, Valentinus. 1589. Illuminirbuch, Knstlich alle Farben zu machen und bereyten. German (Frankfurt, Germany). {painting, graphic arts}

 

1590

LOMAZZO, Giovanni Paolo [1538-1600]. 1590. Idea del tempio della pittura. Italian (Italy). {arts, painting}

 

1599

RINALDI, Giovanni de. 1599. Il mostruosissimo mostro di G. de R. Nel primo dequali si ragiona del significato decolori, Nel secondo si tratta dellherbe e fiori. Italian (Venice, Italy).

 

1601

SCARMILIONIUS, Vidi Antonii. 1601. De coloribus. Latin (Marburg, Germany: Pauli Egenolphi). {natural philosophy, color-music}

 

1609

SAVOT, Louis. 1609. Nova, seu verius nova antiqua de causis colorum sententia. Latin (Paris, France).

 

1611

DOMINIS, M. Antonius. 1611. De radiis visus et lucis in vitris perspectivis et iride. Latin (Venice, Italy).

FORSIUS, Sigfrid Aron [1550-1624]. 1611. Physica. Swedish (Uppsala, Sweden: manuscript in the Royal Library, Stockholm).
Transcription by Johan Nordstrm, in Acta Universitatis Uppsaliensis 10, 1952. Also published in Acta Bibliothecae Stockholmiensis, 1971.
{physics}

 

1612

NERI, Antonio [1576-1614]. 1612. Larte vetraria. Italian (Florence, Italy: Stamperia de' Giunti).
2nd edition (Florence: Marco Rabbuiati, 1661). New edition (Venice: Giacomo Batti, 1663). New edition (Milan: Giovanni Silvestri, 1817).
English translation by Christopher Merret, The art of glass (London: Printed by A. W. for O. Pulleyn, 1662).
{glass, colorants}

 

1613

AGUILONIUS, Franciscus [1567-1617]. 1613. Opticorum libri sex. Latin (Antwerp, Belgium: Plantin). {optics}

 

1629-1631

FLUDD, Robert [1574-1637]. 1629-1631. Medicina catholica, 2 vols. Latin (Frankfurt, Germany: C. Rtelli). {order systems, medicine}

 

1637

DESCARTES, Ren [1596-1650]. 1637. Discours de la methode pour bien conduire la raison, & chercher la verit dans les sciences. Plus La dioptrique. Les meteores. Et La geometrie. French (Leiden, The Netherlands: Imprimerie de Ian Maire).
Electronic edition by Jean-Marie Tremblay, La dioptrique (2002).
Latin translation by tienne de Courcelles, revised by the author, Dissertatio de methodo. Recte regendae rationis, & veritatis in scientiis investigandae: Dioptrice, et Meteora (Amsterdam: Ludovicum Elzevirium, 1644). New
French-Latin edition, Discours de la mthode & essais, vol. 6 of Oeuvres de Descartes, edited by Charles Adam and Paul Tannery (Paris: Leopold Cerf, 1902).
Spanish translation, Discurso del mtodo, diptrica, meteoros y geometra. Discurso octavo, Los meteoros (Madrid: Alfaguara, 1981).
{philosophy, optics}

JUNIUS, Franciscus [1591-1677]. 1637. De pictura veterum. Latin.
English translation, On the painting of the ancients (1638).
Dutch translation, Schilderkonst der Antycken (Amsterdam: Wilhelmus Goeree, 1675).
{painting, history}

 

1646

KIRCHER, Athanasius [1602-1680]. 1646. Ars magna lucis et umbrae. Latin (Rome, Italy). New edition (Amsterdam: Jansson & Waesberge, 1671). {natural philosophy}

MAYERNE, Sir Thodore Turquet de [1573-1655]. 1620-1646 (inter). Pictoria, sculptoria et quae subalternarum artium [Peinture, sculpture et quels mtiers subordonns]. Mainly in French, with title in Latin and some texts in Italian, English, German, Dutch (manuscript in the British Museum, Sloane MS 2052).
Transcription: Quellen fr Maltechnik whrend der Renaissance und deren Folgezeit (XVI-XVII Jahrhundert) in Italien, Spanien nebst dem de Mayerne Manuskript, by Ernst Berger (Munich: Callwey, 1901).
Transcription: Pictoria, sculptoria & quae subalternarum artium, Le manuscrit de Turquet de Mayerne prsent par M. Faidutti et C. Versini (Lyon: Audin, 1974).
Transcription: Thodore Turquet de Mayerne, Pittura, sculptura e delle arti minori, 1620-1646, Ms Sloane 2052 del British Museum di Londra, by Simona Rinaldi (Anzio: De Rubeis, 1995).
English translation: Lost secrets of Flemish painting: Including the first complete English translation of the de Mayerne Manuscript, BM Sloane 2052, by Donald C. Fels, ed. (Floyd, Virginia: Alchemist Inc., 2004).
{painting, colorants}

 

1648

MARCI, Joannes Marcus [1595-1667]. 1648. Thaumantias, liber de arcu coelesti, deque colorum apparentium natura ortu et causs. Latin (Prague, Czech Republic: Jiri Marek). New edition (Prague Pragopress, 1968).

 

1650

CUREAU DE LA CHAMBRE, Marin. 1650. Nouvelles observations et conjectures sur liris. French (Paris, France). {harmony, color-music}

 

inter 1657-1659

SCHOTT, Caspar [1608-1666]. 1657-1659 (inter). Magia universalis naturae et artis, sive recondita naturalium et artificialium rerum scientia, 4 vols. Vol. 1, Optics. Vol. 2, Acoustics. Vol. 3, Mathematics. Vol. 4, Physics. Latin. {physics, optics}

 

1663

{natural philosophy}

{philology, terminology, vision}

{psychology}

{philosophy, arts, aesthetics}

DURO, Maria Joo, ed. 2021. Cor: espao urbano, arquitectura e design. Portughese (Ribeiro, Portugal: Edies Hmus).
English edition, Colour: urban space, architecture and design (Ribeiro, Portugal: Edies Hmus).
{architecture, design, urban landscape}

ROQUE, Georges. 2021. La cochenille, de la teinture la peinture. French (Paris, France: Gallimard). {pigments, dyes, arts, history}

 

2022

LUDWIG, Smi, Astrid STARCK-ADLER, and Andr KARLICZEK, eds. 2022. Colors & cultures: interdisciplinary explorations / Couleurs & cultures: explorations interdisciplinaires. English and French (Jena, Germany: Salana). {history, anthropology, cognition, literature, painting, textiles, technology}

LUZZATTO, Lia, and Renata POMPAS. 2022. I colori sono di tutti? 22 domande curiose sul colore. Italian (Roma, Italy: Edizioni Mediterranee). {general, psychology}

McLACHLAN, Fiona. 2022. Colour beyond the surface: art in architecture. English (London: Lund Humphries Publishers). {art, architecture}

ROA TORRES, Beatriz Eugenia. 2022. Kromtica. Combinaciones efectivas y simbolismo del color para diseadores y artistas. Spanish (Cali, Colombia: Anzuelo Etico Ediciones). {graphic arts, graphic design, harmony, advertising}

 

2023

GROVIER, Kelly. 2023. The art of colour: the history of art in 39 pigments. English (London, England: Thames and Hudson).

KLEINWCHTER, Tanja C., Sarah LOWENGARD, Friedrich STEINLE, eds. 2023. Ordering colours in 18th and early 19th century Europe. English (Cham, Switzerland: Springer). {order systems, history}

SHAMEY, Renzo, ed. 2023. Encyclopedia of color science and technology, 2nd ed. English (Berlin, Germany: Springer). {general}

VARICHON, Anne. 2023. Nuanciers - loge du subtil. French (Paris, France: ditions du Seuil).
English translation by Kate Deimling, Color charts: a history (Princeton, New Jersey, USA: Princeton University Press, 2024).

 

2024

LOSKE, Alexandra [1969-]. 2024. Mary Garside c.1755-1819: Abstract visions of colour. English (Paul Holberton). {art history}
